div.em: Current conditions as of 26 Apr 14:54 pm CDT

div.span: A 20 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms after 3am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. South wind 7 to 10 mph.
A 10 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms before 7am. Mostly sunny, with a high near 78. South wind 5 to 11 mph becoming west in the afternoon.

A 30 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms, mainly after 5am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 55. Northwest wind 5 to 7 mph becoming south southeast in the evening. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.

h3.a: Senior Graduation Update & Other School Related Updates

div.p:
The Senior Class of 2020 will hold graduation on Friday, May 15th @ 7:00 PM.Â Here is the letter explaining all the details.Â
Â
General Announcements with details concerning the end of the year activities, as well as summer activities.Â

div.p:
Just a few reminders as we finish out the school year online.Â
1.Â Students and parents, please continue to check your email.Â There are daily/weekly postings from your teachers.Â Â
2.Â The teachers have " Office Hours" Â that students and/or parents may contact the teachers.Â Â
Â
More information will be coming out soon, please be patient as we ALL go through . . .

Here is a slideshow that can have your child do at home for PE.Â Enjoy!!
This is updated every week.Â Check back regularly for updates.Â Â
A Drills and Skills slideshow has also been added for those of you wanting to do some other drills/skills for some of our lifelong activities.Â Â

h3.a: Letter from School about School Being Canceled

div.p:
The Governor has announced that school has been canceled for the remainder of the year, as well spring sports.Â
Here is a letter to inform you of the Governor's decision and how our district is moving forward.Â Â

p.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

div.div:
The Woodbine Community School District offers career and technical programs in the following service areas: Family Consumer Science, Business, Construction Trades, and Agriculture.
It is the policy of the Woodbine Community School District not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, religion, creed, age (for employment), marital status (for programs), sexual orientation, gender identity and socioeconomic status (for programs) in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. If you have questions or a grievance related to this policy please contact the districtâs Equity Coordinator, Samuel Swenson, High School Principal, 501 Weare Street, Woodbine, Iowa 51579, 712-647-2411.
